question: What is Oracle Identity and Access Management (IAM)?

answers.text: A comprehensive security solution for managing user identities and access to resources

question: Which component of Oracle IAM is responsible for user authentication and authorization?
What is the purpose of Oracle Identity Manager (OIM) in IAM?

answers.text: To manage user identities and their access privileges
To store and manage cryptographic keys

question: Which Oracle IAM component is responsible for providing web single sign-on (SSO) capabilities?
What is the function of Oracle Security Token Service (STS) in IAM?

answers.text: To issue and validate security tokens for authentication

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides directory services and LDAP support?
What is Oracle Adaptive Access Manager (OAAM) used for in IAM?

answers.text: To enhance authentication and fraud detection

question: Which Oracle IAM component is responsible for managing and enforcing access policies?
What is the purpose of Oracle Mobile and Social in IAM?

answers.text: To extend IAM capabilities to mobile and social applications

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides centralized policy administration and enforcement?
What is the purpose of Oracle Privileged Account Manager (PAM) in IAM?

answers.text: To manage and monitor privileged accounts and access

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides user provisioning and de-provisioning capabilities?
What is the purpose of Oracle Unified Directory (OUD) in IAM?

answers.text: To provide a scalable and high-performance directory for identity information

question: Which Oracle IAM component is responsible for managing digital identities and credentials?
What is the role of Oracle Access Management Suite Plus (AOM) in IAM?
Which Oracle IAM component provides a scalable and secure identity and access management infrastructure?
What is the purpose of Oracle Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) in IAM?

answers.text: To provide a comprehensive identity management solution in the cloud

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides real-time, risk-based authentication?
What is the purpose of Oracle Identity Gateway (OIG) in IAM?

answers.text: To simplify integration between Oracle and non-Oracle environments

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides fine-grained authorization for applications?

answers.text: To define and enforce fine-grained authorization policies for applications

question: Which Oracle IAM component provides identity governance and lifecycle management?

answers.text: To enable secure identity sharing and single sign-on across multiple organizations

question: When would you use Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Identity and Access Management (IAM)?

answers.text: To provision and manage compute instances
To establish private connections between on-premises networks and OCI
To provide secure access control to OCI resources
To distribute incoming network traffic across multiple servers

question: What is the role of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) IAM Groups?

answers.text: To perform analytics on cloud usage
To isolate and manage network traffic within the cloud
To organize users with similar job functions and access requirements
To store and retrieve large amounts of unstructured data

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) IAM service allows you to define policies for fine-grained access control?
What is the purpose of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Identity Federation?

answers.text: To establish private connections between on-premises networks and OCI
To provide secure key storage and management services
To enable single sign-on (SSO) to OCI resources using external identity providers
To store and manage Docker container images

To archive data for long-term retention
To provide secure access to OCI resources from on-premises networks
To monitor and manage the performance of OCI resources

question: What is the purpose of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Dynamic Groups?

To dynamically group resources based on matching criteria for policy application
